Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2013 10:09AM Hoppie wrote: I had an ultrasound guided core needle biopsy and sailed right thru it and I'm a big baby. The the stick from the lidocaine needle wasn't even painful, very slight sting at the most. The loud snap was quite surprising as they forgot to tell me and I almost jumped off the table, but the procedure itself was completely painless. I felt some pulling and tugging, but again absolutely no pain. I rested the day off, but didnt feel bad at all and other than being mildly sore, was able to get right back to normal activities. Keep us posted and hoping for b9 results for you.
Posts.Title: Utra-sound guided biopsy keepthefaith snoopy66

Posts.Content: Sep 23, 2013 11:20PM Hoppie wrote: Good Morning, I had a similar situation although, i did not have any draining.  My left nipple started inverting within the last year.  I had a mammo in June, they called back right away and had me come in for a diagnostic mammo.  After the diagnostic mammo, they immediately did an ultrasound, found a small lump just behind my areola and they did 5 core needle biopsies.  Apparently, the lesion looked very much like cancer on ultrasound so when the biopsy came back as a benign nothing (no explanation for the lump, should have been a benign or malignant tumor), I was sent for a contrast MRI.  Nothing showed up on the MRI (although something in my other breast did show up, but didn't show up on mammo).  It wasn't until I had an excisional biopsy with wire locatlization that I got answers.  Mine ended up being a benign sclerosis adenoma lesion.  My breast surgeon stitched my nipple back in place and we are hoping that it stays where it should.  Just had the stitches out this past thursday and so far, so good. I'm hoping for b9 results for you!
Posts.Title: Fibrous breasts, lump, inverted nipple, confused not worried alaskanabbott AlaskaAngel

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2013 10:25AM Hoppie wrote: Hi Jenny lyn and I'm so sorry you are going through this. You can and will get through this. I first came here a few weeks ago after an abnormal mammo. I was called back right away to come back for additional views and left having had 5 corner needle biopsies, the last thing in the world I expected. I stress and worry so I was grateful happened so quickly. My experience With the core needle biopsy, guided by ultrasound, was not bad at all and I am a huge chicken when it comes to procedures. They first numbed my breast and it was a minor little pinch, I didn't even wince and I almost pass out whenever I get blood drawn! I felt absolutely no pain at all during the 5 biopsies, the only sensation was slight pressure. The tech put firm pressure on the area for a couple of minutes, she taped and gauzed the area and I was done. It took 6 days for the results to come in and I was told the biopsy results were "non concordant" with the mammo and US, meaning my tumor looks suspicious for malignancy, but the biopsy came back b9. My radiologist got a second opinion who also agreed with her and they sent me for a contrast mri, which came back inconclusive, but did show 3 areas of concern in my right breast, but due to their shape they are more than likely b9 and should be checked in 6 months. Needless to say, I still do not know what is going on, but I'm meeting with a surgeon on the 15th, the radiologist's are recommending excisional biopsy with possible duct excision. I will be thinking of you and sincerely hope that you have the same experience with your procedure that I did. It's the waiting and not knowing that is the hardest,but the time will pass. No doubt you are busy with 3 children and being busy is the best thing to do right now. Please keep us posted.
Posts.Title: Core biopsy tomorrow I'm 31 yrs. old jenny_lyn geekyknitter

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2013 10:06AM Hoppie wrote: I sure will. I had a nice distraction the last couple of days and now that that is over, I'm back to stressing! I have loads to do here at home so hopefully, I will be able to throw myself into it. My daughter is coming home from Germany this evening, she has been there for a year studying, I so can't wait to see her! I think my stress today is stemming from having to tell her, I don't know where to start. She is only home for about a week before she goes back to college and I'm just not sure how to approach this. When do you go back for your US?
Posts.Title: My biopsy results were benign. Why is doctor still concerned??? Petitegal127 awb

Posts.Content: Hoppie wrote: Around 6-8 months ago, my left nipple started retracting. I'm uninsured and recently heard of a mammogram program in my area so I called and scheduled my first mammogram, I'm 46. I had the mammogram last Friday and first thing Monday morning, I received a call that they needed additional views. They scheduled me for the next morning at 930 (yesterday) and said the radiologist would be there to discuss the results with me. It scared me that I had to go back, they were getting me in so soon and that the radiologist was going to be there. I went yesterday and they did an additional 3 views on my left breast (right breast was fine) and brought into a room while the radiologist went over it. She came back in and said they needed to do an ultrasound. The tech did the ultrasound and left and the doctor and tech came back in where the doctor proceeded to do the ultrasound. The radiologist said she saw a pea sized lump behind my nipple that was "worrisome" and stated she would like to do a biopsy right away! She left and the tech prepped me and they did a core biopsy using the ultrasound to guide her, she took 6 biopsies. They said the results should be in by next Monday. Is it normal for all of this to happen so fast? Will they give me results over the phone or will I have to endure the ride there and wait until they see me to get them. I'm really in shock right now and I'm grateful I've been able to have everything done so quickly, but then there's a part of me that think something's really bad if they are doing everything so quickly. She was able to confirm that it wasn't a cyst and that is why it worried her. If it is not cancer, will they still want to remove it? The waiting is so very difficult, can't imagine having to endure this weekend.... Any ideas on how to make this time pass without worrying too much? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bad Case of the What Ifs! Hoppie Hoppie

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2013 02:44PM Hoppie wrote: I couldn't stand it and called to see if the results are in and she said they should be in today however, the doctor will not be in until Monday and I can't get the results until then. I asked if there was anyone else that could give me the results and she said she wold look, but didnt think so... I know I will make it then the weekend and nothing will change, but the anxiety is pretty high right now. Do you think it would be possible to call where the biopsy was done and see if they could give me the results?
Posts.Title: Bad Case of the What Ifs! Hoppie Hoppie

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2013 05:12PM Hoppie wrote: I just received a call from the radiologist and all 6 biopsies came back negative. She said she was not comfortable with theses results because everything she saw on the US made her believe it was cancer. They are now scheduling me for an MRI. Has anyone ever had a false negative from a core biopsy?
Posts.Title: Bad Case of the What Ifs! Hoppie Hoppie

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2013 07:30PM Hoppie wrote: Not sure if this has anything to do with it, but she did tell me I have very dense breast tissue and another factor may be the tumor is so small, 4 mm. One would think the 6 biopsies she took would have removed the whole thing. We know something is going on as my left nipple began retracting approx. 8 months ago and has only gotten worse. Thank you so much for your responses, the waiting is excruciating and it is so nice having support from people who truly understand.
Posts.Title: Bad Case of the What Ifs! Hoppie Hoppie

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2013 01:51PM Hoppie wrote: I had the same thing happen as well. The soreness would come and go and it was never painful, just sore.
Posts.Title: Lump after Biopsy? samanthaD samanthaD

Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2013 02:19PM Hoppie wrote: Petitegal, thank you so much for the well wishes. The 15th is my first meeting with the surgeon, which it he goes With the radiologists recommendations, we will be discussing an excisional biopsy with possible duct removal. I saw the possible duct removal in my records that I just received and not sure why they want to remove it as it has never bend discussed. It sure does help talking about it and this venue has been a godsend as has family and friends. At times I feel paralyzed and other times I am okay. If I am busy, the time goes fast, if I'm not, it goes very slowly. The big girl in me knows what I should do, but sometimes the little girl in me takes over. It's a scary journey I wouldn't wish on anyone, but very comforting to know you get through this as so many on here have and you become stronger. I honestly think I will be okay when I find out what is going on and if a plan needs to be formulated then that is my chosen path.
Posts.Title: My biopsy results were benign. Why is doctor still concerned??? Petitegal127 awb

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2013 12:23PM Hoppie wrote: After being told by the doctors office to call this morning for my results at 830am, I'm met with a message the office is closed and they open at 9am. I call at 9am and was told the results might be in the stack that is not scanned yet and the nurse already has a note to call me. I called the breast center that did the biopsy last Tuesday and after she asked my name, she said, "oh, that one. It's still on the doctors desk waiting to be added as an addendum to the US report." She said I can call back later today and hopefully it will be ready. It's so hard not to think the worse and even harder knowing the results are there but nobody can tell you anything.
Posts.Title: Bad Case of the What Ifs! Hoppie Hoppie

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2013 02:30PM Hoppie wrote: I am in a similar situation as you. Abnormal mammo, diagnostic mammo and ultrasound were suspicious for malignancy, 5 core needle biopsies benign. I was sent for a contrast mri, which came back inconclusive, so I'm off to see the surgeon on the 15th. The radiologist is recommending excisional biopsy with possible duct removal. The waiting is the hardest part, I find keeping busy is the best way to past time. I have my moments, some more frequently than others and I find the not knowing the hardest part. Seek out family and close friends, it's really important, I feel so fortunate for mine, they help keep things in perspective.
